A decade is a long time to be a CEO, Eric Schmidt said during the call. Sergey Brin , meanwhile, will devote his time and energy to strategic projects, in particular working on new products. "I'm looking forward to many more decades

executive chairman, "a lot of my time" will be devoted to dealing with regulators and other government officials, Eric Schmidt said. "We've got very complicated government issues," he said, adding that we move quickly, and we tend to be disruptive at scale. European Union officials opened a formal antitrust probe last year into Google Inc. search results, while in China the company opted to shut down its mainland search engine rather than censor results for user queries.

to Be Rude, But..." in which he laid down five important principles that actors can use when auditioning. 1. Don't grovel when you come in. Simon Cowell writes I look upon it[ groveling] as a sign of desperation. So many times people come in and they come up with this terrible dialogue about how much they like me or Randy or Paula. It's demeaning, and there's no point to it. We're not looking for a nice person; we're looking for somebody who's confident and assured, but talented above all. Trust me-- most stars aren't nice. 2. Page, now 37 and graying. While Eric Schmidt travels the world meeting with business partners, government officials and potential takeover targets, Page said he will be making most of the big decisions as he tries to rekindle the soul and passion of a startup. Brin will concentrate on developing new products. He's worth$ 15 billion, but Page remains something of a rebel who has always had a disdain for corporate protocol.
